result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron Javier Claypool Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All other conditions are left up to the discretion of the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court sets restitution at zero.

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm and body armor possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron Javier Claypool Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Byron Javier Claypool Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for sentencing hearing. Defendant was not produced. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from defendant. Byron Claypool Jr. #631324 Oshkosh Correctional Institution PO Box 3530 Oshkosh WI, 54903

Defendant Byron Javier Claypool Jr not in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Byron Javier Claypool Jr.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing. Defendant not produced; defense requested adjournment. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36; defendant to be produced for the next court date. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court scheduled the matter for resentencing on September 23, 2022 at 8:30 AM.  Parties notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Laura A. Crivello, Br. 36, for review. mag

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Restitution Determination (DOC-31, DOC-37)
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X   ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended. Forwarded to Post Conviction.
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
Received and Filed.

Defendant Byron Javier Claypool Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Byron Javier Claypool Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin.Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- All other conditions are left up to the discretion of the Department of Corrections.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm and body armor possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Byron Javier Claypool in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Byron Javier Claypool in court, in custody.   BOTH BY VIDEO.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
